fields.description:
When a user logs into an instance that is running on a Eucalyptus Open Source
2.0.3 Cloud (in Managed Mode), and they perform an DNS lookups on the public
and private IP address, the result is inconsistent.  Public IP address works
with dig, but not nslookup.  Private IP address does not work.  Information
about the cloud and instance is as follows:

  
## network information on Front-End ###

  

VNET_MODE="MANAGED"

VNET_SUBNET="10.7.0.0"

VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"

VNET_DNS="8.8.8.8"

VNET_ADDRSPERNET="16"

VNET_PUBLICIPS="1xx.2xx.1xx.131-1xx.2xx.1xx.170"

VNET_CLOUDIP="1xx.2xx.1xx.130"

VNET_LOCALIP="1xx.2xx.1xx.130"

  
## WebUI Configuration for DNS ##

  
Domain name:  eucasys.com

Nameserver:  test.eucalyptus.com

IP:  1xx.2xx.1xx.130

## resolv.conf information in instance ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# cat /etc/resolv.conf

nameserver 8.8.8.8

nameserver 10.7.125.17

  
## Instance IP information ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# ip addr show

1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN

link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00

inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo

inet6 ::1/128 scope host

valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc pfifo_fast state UP
qlen 1000

link/ether d0:0d:3f:00:07:1b brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff

inet 10.7.124.242/28 brd 10.7.124.255 scope global eth0

inet6 fe80::d20d:3fff:fe00:71b/64 scope link

valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

  
## Instance DNS Information (euca-describe-instances) ##

  
public:  euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

  
private:  euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

  
## nslookup tests ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

Server: 8.8.8.8

Address: 8.8.8.8#53

Non-authoritative answer:

Name: euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

Address: 1xx.2xx.1xx.131

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

Server: 8.8.8.8

Address: 8.8.8.8#53

** server can't find euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal: NXDOMAIN

  
## nslookup tests against CLC ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal 1xx.2xx.1xx.130

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.188.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com
1xx.2xx.1xx.130

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

  
## dig test (short) ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# dig +short euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

173.205.188.131

root@ubuntu:~# dig +short euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

root@ubuntu:~#

## dig test (verbose) ##

  

root@ubuntu:~# dig @test.eucalyptus.com
euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

; <<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>> @test.eucalyptus.com
euca-1xx-2xx-1xx-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

; (1 server found)

;; global options: +cmd

;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

  

root@ubuntu:~# dig @test.eucalyptus.com euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 1xx.2xx.1xx.130#53

; <<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>> @test.eucalyptus.com
euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

; (1 server found)

;; global options: +cmd

;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

Please let me know if more information needs to be provided.

  
Regards,

--   
Harold L Spencer, Jr.

Technical Support Engineer

  
Eucalyptus Systems,Inc.

6755 Hollister Ave., Ste. 200 | Goleta, CA | 93117

Office: 805-845-8000

harold.spencer.jr@eucalyptus.com

 Transaction: Ticket created by harold.spencer.jr

     Subject: DNS Queries Not Working Correctly in Dynamic DNS enabled
 Eucalyptus Cloud
       Owner: dan.nurmi
  Requestors: harold.spencer@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5517 >


When a user logs into an instance that is running on a Eucalyptus Open Source
2.0.3 Cloud (in Managed Mode), and they perform an DNS lookups on the public
and private IP address, the result is inconsistent. Public IP address works
with dig, but not nslookup. Private IP address does not work. Information about
the cloud and instance is as follows:

## network information on Front-End (happens to be ECC) ###

VNET_MODE="MANAGED" VNET_SUBNET="10.7.0.0" VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_DNS="8.8.8.8" VNET_ADDRSPERNET="16"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="173.205.188.131-173.205.188.170" VNET_CLOUDIP="173.205.188.130"
VNET_LOCALIP="173.205.188.130"

## WebUI Configuration for DNS ##

Domain name: eucasys.com
Nameserver: ecc.eucalyptus.com
IP: 173.205.188.130 ## resolv.conf information in instance ##

root@ubuntu:~# cat /etc/resolv.conf nameserver 8.8.8.8 nameserver 10.7.125.17
## Instance IP information ##

root@ubuntu:~# ip addr show 1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 16436 qdisc
noqueue state UNKNOWN link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo inet6 ::1/128 scope host valid_lft forever
preferred_lft forever 2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc
pfifo_fast state UP qlen 1000 link/ether d0:0d:3f:00:07:1b brd
ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff inet 10.7.124.242/28 brd 10.7.124.255 scope global eth0 inet6
fe80::d20d:3fff:fe00:71b/64 scope link valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
## Instance DNS Information (euca-describe-instances) ##

public: euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com

private: euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal

## nslookup tests ##

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com Server:
8.8.8.8 Address: 8.8.8.8#53 Non-authoritative answer: Name:
euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com Address: 173.205.188.131
root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal Server: 8.8.8.8
Address: 8.8.8.8#53 ** server can't find euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal:
NXDOMAIN
## nslookup tests against ECC (173.205.188.130) ##

root@ubuntu:~# nslookup euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal 173.205.188.130
;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53
;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53
;; reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached root@ubuntu:~# nslookup
euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com 173.205.188.130 ;; reply from
unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;; reply from
unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;; reply from
unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;; connection
timed out; no servers could be reached
## dig test (short) ##

root@ubuntu:~# dig +short euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com
173.205.188.131 root@ubuntu:~# dig +short euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal
root@ubuntu:~# ## dig test (verbose) ##

root@ubuntu:~# dig @ecc.eucalyptus.com
euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com ;; reply from unexpected source:
10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;; reply from unexpected source:
10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;; reply from unexpected source:
10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ; <<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>>
@ecc.eucalyptus.com euca-173-205-188-131.eucalyptus.eucasys.com ; (1 server
found) ;; global options: +cmd ;; connection timed out; no servers could be
reached

root@ubuntu:~# dig @ecc.eucalyptus.com euca-10-7-124-242.eucalyptus.internal ;;
reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;;
reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;;
reply from unexpected source: 10.7.124.241#53, expected 173.205.188.130#53 ;
<<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>> @ecc.eucalyptus.com

According to our records, your request has been resolved. If you have any
further questions or concerns, please respond to this message.
Issue has resurfaced in Eucalyptus 3.1.

I'm running into the same (or at least similar problem), with the extra caveat that it looks like my public DNS is resolving to my public IP if I try to resolve it within the VM (whereas in AWS I get a private IP if I try to resolve it within the VM).

[~graziano] will the change in behavior for this case causes issues in the field if introduced in 3.2.2 v. 3.3.0? Also, its my understanding that, from inside the instance, when you query for any of your hostnames you should be returned the private IP and that any outside hosts querying your name should get the public IP. Is this true. What about another host within the same security group?

[~graziano], I was just playing around with a setup that reproduced this issue. As I was thinking, one main problem I see is that the request seen at the CLC is always coming from the DNS server, i.e. we do not have the context at the CLC about the original querier. So if I don't know where the query originated, I can't tell if it was originated from inside or outside the instance! The only service at this points that knows the answer may be the CC.
